pullRequest.body:
Make sure that, when `μ : FiniteMeasure Ω`, `f =ᵐ[μ] g` elaborates to `f =ᵐ[↑μ] g` instead of complaining about `OuterMeasureClass (FiniteMeasure Ω) (Set Ω) ℝ≥0∞` not existing.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/ae.20of.20a.20finite.20measure)


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a2c66e1be7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13740/commits/a2c66e1be726d1a1ef3301f7d9697b5ed468ee8f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ elabAELE`
`+ elabMeasure`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
You may want to try `Measure ?_` first, because otherwise Lean may decide to cast a `Measure` to an `OuterMeasure`.

Sorry, you got misled by a typo in my docstring. It's supposed to be
```suggestion
/-- Try to elaborate `μ` as a term of type `T` where `OuterMeasureClass T`. If that fails, try to
elaborate `μ` as `Measure ?Ω`. -/
```
What am I doing wrong here? It's expecting `μ'` to be a `TSyntax`, but my `μ'` is a `Expr`

Instead of going back and forth between Expr and Syntax here, I think it would be be better to translate `$f =ᵐ[$μ] $g` to `Filter.EventuallyEq (MeasureTheory.ae (elab_as_measure% $μ)) $f $g` (with a `macro`) where `elab_as_measure` is itself an elaborator.
Okay but what about my comment on Zulip? Will your solution let me use the expected type of the functions to elaborate the measure?

I have no idea, try it and see!

(my guess would be yes, because the elaboration order will change, whereas your current version forces the wrong order)

I'm surprised `‹_›` works here!

It might be better to instead put `@[term_elab elab_as_measure]` on the `def` above and use
```suggestion
syntax (name := elab_as_measure) "elab_as_measure% " term : term
```
which also shortcuts some expected type logic you might not need.
I looked at the context and saw there was an inaccessible `Option Expr` 🕵️

```
@[term_elab elab_as_measure]
def elabMeasure (μ : Syntax) (expectedType? : Option Expr) : TermElabM Expr := do
```
errors with
```
unexpected type at 'Mathlib.Meta.elabMeasure', `Lean.Elab.Term.TermElab` expected
```
Any idea why `(hf : 0 ≤ᵐ[ν] f)` was erroring with `nonexhaustive match` without that change?
Yes, because otherwise you have `v : ?T` and `?T : Sort ?u`, and `?u` is a metavariable so does not participate in the match.
You're missing the match for `.zero` or universe metavariables here
`zero` I just discard, right? How should I handle metavariables? Should I assign them before matching?

pullRequest.title: feat: More robust ae notation
